network

Class Network

  • java.lang.Object
    • network.Network

  • public class Network
extends java.lang.Object
    Network is an essential class in Netter. Representing a network both as a collection of Links and as a collection of Nodes. Network's can have temporary states, with links temporaraly removed or added.
    Since:
    0.0
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Joeri Ruyssinck (joeri.ruysssinck@intec.ugent.be)

      Copy constructor, will return a copy of the network with new objects
      Network(java.lang.String tsvFile, int numberOfLines)
      Creates a network by reading a certain amount of lines from a tsv file.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Network

        public Network()
        Construct an empty network and inits the members

      • Network

        public Network(Network network)
        Copy constructor, will return a copy of the network with new objects
        Parameters:
        network - the network to be copied

      • Network

        public Network(java.lang.String tsvFile,
               int numberOfLines)
        Creates a network by reading a certain amount of lines from a tsv file. File should be formatted, each link separated by newline Each link should be formatted as: source[whitespace]target[whitespace] all other text will be ignored A LinkProperties object will be attached to each link, the ranking position equals the line number Checks that links need to be unique and cannot be self-regulating
        Parameters:
        tsvFile - string representation of file to read network from
        numberOfLines - links/lines to read (for big files)

    • Method Detail

      • networkToTSV

        public void networkToTSV(java.io.File file)
        Writes this network to a tsv file in the following format. Each link separated by newline in the order of ranking. Each link formatted as: source[whitespace]target[whitespace]ranking
        Parameters:
        file - file to write the network to
        numberOfLines - links/lines to read (for big files)

      • sortNetworkPredictionRank

        public void sortNetworkPredictionRank()
        Sorts the links by rank

      • sortNetworkNameLink

        public void sortNetworkNameLink()
        Sorts the links by name

      • addLinkToNetwork

        public boolean addLinkToNetwork(Link link)
        Adds a link to the network permanently, returns false if links already exists or if it is a self-regulating link
        Parameters:
        link - the link to be added
        Returns:
        true if link was added, false otherwhise

      • removeLinkFromNetwork

        public Link removeLinkFromNetwork(int index)
        Removes a link at a certain index permanently in the network. Use with care if the network is sorted by name.
        Parameters:
        index - the index at which the link is located
        Returns:
        The link which was removed

      • removeLinkFromNetwork

        public Link removeLinkFromNetwork(Link e)
        Removes the link specified from the network permanently.
        Parameters:
        e - the link to remove
        Returns:
        The link which was removed

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Checks if the network is empty
        Returns:
        true if network does not contain links, false otherwhise

      • hashCode

        public int hashCode()
        Overwrites hash code for network, network is uniquely defined by name
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class java.lang.Object

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object network)
        Overrides equals. Network's are equal if their names are by definition.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object

      • revert

        public void revert()
        Reverts network to original state. All temporary links which were added or removed will be restored.

      • commit

        public void commit()
        Commits network by making all temporary modifications permanent.

      • sortOriginalRankInterval

        public void sortOriginalRankInterval(int interval,
                                     int startPos,
                                     int endPos)
        Alters the current ranking by tie-breaking on the original ranking
        Parameters:
        interval - Partition sizes
        startPos - Start of the ranking to be resorted
        endPos - End of the ranking to be resorted
